items.sentence: I wonder whether or not Tom still lives in Boston.
I wonder whether or not this is some sort of scam.
Tom has been sick in bed for the past three weeks.
Tom introduced me to his new girlfriend yesterday.
Tom assumed that Mary would pay her bills on time.
Tom opened the door and was surprised to see Mary.
Tom started playing the tuba when he was thirteen.
Tom stood up for his friend who was being bullied.
Do you think Tom would mind if we didn\'t do that?
Do you want me to say that I\'ll stop seeing Mary?
Tom wondered what Mary was going to ask him to do.
Tom and Mary don\'t know what they should do next.
I think it must\'ve been Tom who broke the window.
I think it\'s a little too cold to go on a picnic.
I think it\'s more dangerous than you think it is.
I can\'t do my job without an internet connection.
I can\'t imagine myself doing something like that.
You don\'t deserve the salary they\'re paying you.
Give me your phone number and I\'ll call you back.
I wonder why Tom didn\'t come to school yesterday.
Everyone in the office knew about Tom\'s problems.
I\'m not going to let Tom go to Boston by himself.
I don\'t like cats and my brother doesn\'t either.
Tom pretended he didn\'t see Mary do what she did.
She made up her mind to graduate from high school.
She started doing her homework right after dinner.
If Tom\'s not careful, he\'s going to get injured.
This is the third time that I\'ve seen this movie.
I made a list of things I needed to bring with me.
I need help translating this document into French.
I think I can keep Tom from bothering you anymore.
Do you think Tom would care if we didn\'t do that?
Tom was arrested by a plainclothes police officer.
Tom was in his room all afternoon, doing homework.
Tom quit his job because he didn\'t like his boss.
Tom laid his cards down on the table with a smile.
Tom left the room without saying a word to anyone.
I don\'t think I\'d enjoy playing tennis with Tom.
I don\'t think I\'ll ever go back to Boston again.
I can\'t possibly do that without someone\'s help.
Tom sends more than a hundred text messages a day.
Tom sensed that something bad was going to happen.
You look like somebody I went to high school with.
You seem to have mistaken me for my older brother.
You should be careful not to become overconfident.
They waited on the porch until it stopped raining.
This hat is too small. Please show me another one.
This vending machine takes only hundred-yen coins.
Tom concealed the fact that he had been in prison.
Tom could barely hear what Mary was trying to say.
Tom could still hear Mary crying in the next room.
Tom doesn\'t understand what you expect him to do.
I don\'t think Tom will be in Australia next week.
I don\'t think Tom will go to Boston next weekend.
I don\'t think that Tom is as creative as Mary is.
Nobody can do that as well as I can, not even Tom.
Not all of the passengers were wearing seat belts.
Tom was afraid he might do something he\'d regret.
I\'d like to know more about what happened to Tom.
I called Tom, but his number\'s been disconnected.
I can\'t imagine what it would be like to do that.
You seem to have lost sight of original objective.
Tom can\'t do it alone. Could you please help him?
You\'re the one who needs to go on a diet, not me.
You\'re the one who suggested coming to this club.
You\'re the only other person who knows the truth.
You\'re the only person I know who is from Boston.
Tom couldn\'t remember exactly what Mary had said.
Tom always seems to be concentrating on something.
Tom always seems to have trouble making decisions.
Tom always seems to have trouble talking to women.
Tom always wears a tie to work, except on Fridays.
I suspect that Tom doesn\'t want to do that today.
I teach Tom\'s children French three times a week.
Tom couldn\'t afford to buy the bicycle he wanted.
I don\'t think Tom would help me with my homework.
I don\'t think anyone really expected you to help.
I don\'t think anyone really thought Tom was busy.
I don\'t think that Tom is planning on doing that.
I want everybody to know that I\'m not a murderer.
The thermometer says it\'s thirty degrees in here.
Tom would\'ve been able to do that if he\'d tried.
I suspect that Tom won\'t want to do that with us.
Tom said he needed a day or two to think about it.
Tom said he needed to get rid of a bunch of stuff.
Unless Tom is sober, I don\'t want him helping us.
We can\'t abandon Tom just when he needs our help.
Tom hoped Mary would come back home for Christmas.
Tom is a handsome man, apparently in his thirties.
I don\'t think Tom knows Mary can\'t speak French.
Tom had a big smile on his face when he said that.
Tom had a headache so he took a couple of aspirin.
Did Tom really want Mary to go to Boston with him?
Did you get a Christmas present for Tom this year?
Did you meet many interesting people at the party?
Tom was sure Mary didn\'t know how to drive a car.
I\'ve seen several accidents in front of my house.
If I were you, I wouldn\'t sing that kind of song.
Tom had the grim task of identifying Mary\'s body.
Tom had to do that even though he didn\'t want to.
